summary: Build a running motivation app that helps users stay motivated to run every day.
architectural_notes: Centralize app display name/branding strings so renaming updates all UI text consistently.
Centralize branding assets (logo files/paths) similarly to branding strings so logo changes propagate consistently across the UI.
known_issues: UI still shows the old app name (RunMotivate) instead of the requested new name (PacePowet).
Logo still uses the old branding and needs to be updated to match PacePower.
imageRequirements:
## Edit Images
- Redesign the existing logo with updated PacePower branding (run-logo.dim_512x512.png > pacepower-logo.dim_512x512.png)

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity sign-in and associate all user data (goals, run logs, streak) with the authenticated principal; allow a limited guest mode if the user is not signed in.

Build the core frontend screens and navigation for the running motivation app: (1) Dashboard (today’s motivation + goal + streak), (2) Log a Run form, (3) History list/detail of run logs, and (4) Settings for daily goal and preferences.

Add a motivation system that encourages daily running: show a daily motivational message, progress feedback toward today’s goal, and celebratory UI when a user completes today’s run or extends a streak.
Implement achievements/badges that unlock based on consistent running (e.g., first run, 3-day streak, 7-day streak, total runs milestones) and display them in the UI.

Add an in-app reminder UX (no external push notifications): allow users to set a preferred reminder time and show a prominent reminder banner when the current local time is past the reminder time and today’s run is not completed.
Create a coherent, distinct visual theme for the app (colors, typography, layout, components) suitable for a running motivation product, and apply it consistently across all screens.

Add basic safety and data-validation rules: validate run log inputs (non-negative numbers, reasonable limits), prevent duplicate run submissions for the same time accidentally (client-side), and handle backend errors with user-friendly messages.

Update the app’s user-facing branding so the visible app name displays as “PacePower” (capital P, capital P) everywhere in the frontend, replacing any remaining “RunMotivate” strings (including header logo alt text, header title text, footer copyright text, onboarding/profile setup dialog title, and any welcome/toast messages). Also update the HTML document title to use “PacePower” branding.
Create a new PacePower logo image (replacing the current header logo) and include it as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated.

Update the app header to use the new PacePower logo image instead of /assets/generated/run-logo.dim_512x512.png, without changing the visible app name text ('PacePower') or the logo alt text ('PacePower').

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a running app that motivates users to run every day

Create a backend data model and API to store and retrieve running motivation app data per user: user profile (display name optional), daily goal settings (e.g., minutes or distance as a number + unit), run logs (date, duration, distance optional, notes), computed streak information, and earned achievements/badges.
Update app branding so the UI displays the new app name (change visible text from RunMotivate to PacePowet everywhere).
Update/replace the app logo to match the new PacePower branding.
